userInput:
Feature Name: Gaming Goals
Description: Allow users to set personal gaming goals and track progress, such as 'play 10 games from the backlog by the end of the year' or 'try one JRPG'. This taps into gamers' natural love for achievements and goal-setting.
Target Users: Goal-oriented gamers who want structure and motivation in their gaming habits, completionist players, and users looking to diversify their gaming experiences
Business Context: Increase user engagement and retention by providing motivation and structure to gaming habits, encouraging more active use of the backlog management features
Initial Success Metrics: User engagement with backlog completion, goal achievement rates, return user activity

requirements.questions: 10 clarifying questions covering goal creation, progress tracking, social features, Steam integration, and modification rules
requirements.userStories: 8 comprehensive user stories covering completionist, explorer, time-conscious, platform-focused, social, streak-motivated, overwhelmed, and analytics-focused users
requirements.integration: Detailed analysis of backlog management, Steam integration, user profile integration, and dashboard widget integration
requirements.edgeCases: 6 key edge cases including progress conflicts, retroactive application, goal modification, Steam sync discrepancies, privacy conflicts, and data consistency

problem.coreProblems: Gaming motivation crisis: backlog paralysis, completion avoidance, lack of progress awareness, motivation decay
problem.userPersonas: 4 detailed personas: Completionist Curator (primary), Genre Explorer, Time-Conscious Parent, Achievement Hunter
problem.currentState: Collection-focused behavior without decision framework, progress invisibility, motivation gaps
problem.impactMetrics: Low completion rates, frequent status changes without progress, high dashboard visits with low conversion
problem.competitive: Analysis of Xbox Game Pass, PlayStation trophies, Steam achievements, and productivity app parallels
problem.risks: User churn, competitive disadvantage, reduced engagement, technical debt from partial implementation

solution.designPhilosophy: Gaming Joy Enhancement - choice assistance, completion satisfaction, fun discovery, gentle progress
solution.architecture: Build on existing partial implementation: GamingGoal model, repository pattern, dashboard integration
solution.coreFeatures: Goal creation wizard, automatic progress tracking, dashboard widgets, celebration system
solution.integration: Auto-update from BacklogItem changes, Steam data leverage, user profile enhancement
solution.risks: Over-engineering complexity, making gaming feel like work, performance impact, data consistency
solution.implementation: 4-phase rollout over 8 weeks with progressive enhancement

humanValidations.problemRefinement: Human feedback: Gaming is a hobby, not work. 'Progress Invisibility' and 'Motivation Decay' imply gaming needs measurement/growth, which contradicts the fun nature of gaming. Focus on choice paralysis and completion satisfaction instead.
humanValidations.solutionApproval: Technical approach approved: 1) Build on existing partial implementation ✅, 2) Gaming joy enhancement principles ✅, 3) Auto-progress from backlog completion ✅, 4) Keep 'Goal Progress' terminology ✅, 5) 8-week implementation phases ✅
